isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992-1993 - ECM DIAGNOSTICS - Diagnostic System

svcprocinfo.para: A diagnostic check may be performed using the Diagnostic ON/OFF switch or Prolink EST.

svcsubproc.title: Diagnostic ON/OFF Switch
svcsubproc.para: Any error codes will be flashed through the yellow check engine light.

caution.para: Do not turn the Diagnostic ON/OFF switch to the ON position while operating the vehicle. The throttle will be forced to the idle position affecting vehicle operation.

svcsubproc.para: To determine the fault codes, use the following procedure:

step1.para: Begin the procedure with the engine OFF.
Hold the diagnostic switch in the ON position (releasing the switch will stop the diagnostic display procedure).
Turn the ignition key switch to the ON position (not crank position).
The first fault code will begin flashing on the yellow engine warning light.

svcsubproc.para: For example, the yellow engine warning light blinks out: FLASH FLASH.
The first digit is 2, then a short pause, FLASH FLASH FLASH FLASH FLASH. The second digit is 5. The code flashed was 25, which is system OK.

note.para: All Series 60 fault codes are two digits.

step1.para: If more than one fault code is present, there will be a three second pause between flashes. All active codes will continue to flash in sequence until the diagnostics are turned off.
To stop the diagnostic procedure, release the diagnostic ON/OFF switch.

svcsubproc.para: The Detroit Diesel Operators manual furnished with the vehicle and the Detroit Diesel DDEC II Troubleshooting Guide contain the fault codes and diagnostic procedure.
If the fault code(s) or symptoms indicate a need to troubleshoot a International installed circuit or component, procedures are included in TROUBLESHOOTING section of this chapter.

svcsubproc.title: Prolink EST
svcsubproc.para: The Prolink EST with a Detroit Diesel Cartridge can also be used to read fault codes. Refer to the MPSI Prolink manual for information relating to the EST.
The Detroit Diesel Operators manual furnished with the vehicle and the Detroit Diesel DDEC II Troubleshooting Guide contain the fault codes and diagnostic procedure.
If the fault code(s) or symptoms indicate a need to troubleshoot a International installed circuit or component, procedures are included in TROUBLESHOOTING.
